channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.description:
Blue tag

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hudson Street, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Deep pothole, 29th September
item.description:
Between Longacre farm & Tall Trees on Brockhampton Lane one severe pothole and a couple more getting worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of street lighting on this corner, 29th September
item.description:
Residents have complained that it is very dark walking round into Tudor Lodge Road from the Park and have suggested a street light in the right hand curve (before reaching the telegraph pole, perhaps?). There is a street light near number 4 Tudor Lodge Road but there is a lot of vegetation / trees on the curve of the road opposite the wall of Hilgay Lodge.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tudor Lodge Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedge, 29th September
item.description:
The hedge along this section of path is very overgrown, restricting use if the path by all residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Willow Park Drive, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excellent work, 29th September
item.description:
The new shared use access between the A40 and Camden Road looks superb, a vast improvement on what existed before. One request: could it be left like this without road markings? As a cyclist I automatically slow on approach and there's plenty of room to negotiate with other users. Markings would create more conflict and sense of entitlement. I'd argue it's safer lije this. Any chance of at least postponing so this proposal can be considered?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Campden Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath and garden on the corner of Bishops Drive and Two Hedges Road, 29th September
item.description:
According to the Local Government (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 1976 the law requires homeowners to keep their gardens in good condition or they could be fined up to £500. This garden is an absolute eyesore and their flowers, shrubs, thorny bushes grow out over the pavement. It’s been like it for at least 5 years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11,13, Two Hedges Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement obstruction by very busy road, 29th September
item.description:
Large weeds etc growing outward and making an obstruction when walking on the pavement by a very busy main road. This route is used walking children to school too.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grange Drive, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light not working., 28th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Finchcroft Lane, Noverton, Cheltenham

item.title: This pothole (by the collapsed wall) was repaired recently, 28th September
item.description:
And now it's sunk again to another 10cm hole. Just as dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Gloucester

item.title: Car parked on pavement for weeks (possibly abandoned?), 28th September
item.description:
The car NX65 HUP has been parked on the pavement on this cul de sac for a couple of weeks and doesn't appear to have moved in that time. It is taxed. It is on the pavement so the pavement can't be used properly
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Moor Court Drive, Lynworth, Cheltenham

item.title: M5 south about 1/2 mile before junction 11, 28th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Tewkesbury

item.title: Pothole on lane 1 nearside, 27th September
item.description:
Significant abrupt pothole on nearside of lane 1. Caused significant damage to my alloy wheel on 20/9/23.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Tewkesbury

item.title: Vehicles parked in mandatory cycle lane, 27th September
item.description:
Happens very often, not only blocking mandatory cycle lane but also the footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Henrietta Street, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Dangerous manhole cover, 27th September
item.description:
Cars driving over it, not only is it noisy but it looks like it is about to fall through at any moment which could cause serious injury and damage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Swindon Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep Potholes on a Blind Bend at Top of Aggs Hill, 26th September
item.description:
At least 2 deep potholes are at the location which is forcing vehicles to move to the centre of the road on a blind bend. This is more problematic going up the hill as 1 of the potholes is right at the edge of the road (where vehicles also turn left into the property there) and where a vehicle should be positioned on the road to negotiate the bend. Please can these be filled in.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aggs Hill, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Possible Water Leak, 25th September
item.description:
It looks like a new bit of Pavement has a water leak. North bound side of the road, before the Roubdabout.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Springbank Road, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Narrow footpath, 25th September
item.description:
The footpath that runs through the park adjacent to Greatfield park school is now extremely narrow. The tarmac path is intact x2 the width of what’s showing but the grass and weeds have not been edged properly for a number of years. This causes issues with bikes, mobility scooters and wheelchairs users when passing in opposite directions. Please can this be edged back to the full width of the original tarmac path and edge which is currently hidden from view.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Selworthy, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
